concise_definition: v. 匆忙, 急速前进; n. 急忙, 人流高峰

definitions.explanation_en: To move or act with great speed or urgency, often due to pressure, time constraints, or excitement.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因压力、时间紧迫或兴奋而以极快的速度移动或行动。
definitions.example_en: She rushed to the hospital after receiving the emergency call.
definitions.example_cn: 她接到紧急电话后急忙赶往医院。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause something to be done hastily or without proper care or consideration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因仓促而使某事未经充分考虑或细致处理就完成。
definitions.example_en: Don't rush the project—quality matters more than speed.
definitions.example_cn: 别赶工，质量比速度更重要。

definitions.explanation_en: A sudden, intense surge of people, traffic, or activity, often occurring at a specific time.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在特定时间发生的大量人群、交通或活动的突然激增。
definitions.example_en: There was a lunchtime rush at the café, and we had to wait 20 minutes.
definitions.example_cn: 咖啡馆午餐时间人潮汹涌，我们等了二十分钟。

definitions.explanation_en: A brief period of intense activity or excitement, often involving a sudden desire to acquire something.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一段短暂而激烈的活动或兴奋期，常伴随对某物的突然强烈需求。
definitions.example_en: There was a rush to buy the new smartphone the moment it was released.
definitions.example_cn: 新款智能手机一发布，人们就争相抢购。

comparison.analysis: “Hurry” (匆忙) 强调因时间紧迫而加快动作，常带有焦虑或不安的情绪，多用于日常口语。而 “rush” 不仅指速度，还隐含一种更强烈、更失控的紧迫感，甚至可能伴随混乱或鲁莽。
“Sprint” (短跑/冲刺) 专指在短时间内以最大速度奔跑，通常用于体育语境，强调体力爆发。而 “rush” 更广泛，可用于抽象行为（如 rush to decide），不局限于身体运动。
“Dash” (冲/疾走) 指短距离的快速移动，通常有明确的目的地，动作短暂而果断，语气较轻快。而 “rush” 可持续较长时间，且常带有压力或混乱的负面含义，如 rush to meet a deadline。
